title: Ticket #2447: EC2_GAHP fails to scale.
description:
From Seo-Young Noh: 

  I am just writing to let you know what we have found at Fermilab while
  submitting vms using condor-7.7.0-1.x86_64. condor-7.7.0-prelease given
  to us a few months ago has some issue.


  I tried to submit 20 vms to fermicloud using condor-7.7.0. At certain
  point, all jobs shown in condor_q were turning their states from
  "running" to "held". The log message shows that it is because of "Unable
  to read from accesskey file". Accesskey file is of course readable;
  otherwise vms could not be launched. Below are text captures for this
  symptoms.


  [rsyoung@fermicloud125 vm-submit]$ condor_q
  -- Submitter: fermicloud125.fnal.gov


   ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE
   1.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:26   0+01:36:39 R  0   0.0
   2.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:32   0+01:30:23 R  0   0.0
   3.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:40   0+01:22:28 R  0   0.0
   4.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:40   0+01:22:28 R  0   0.0
   5.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:49   0+01:13:30 R  0   0.0
   6.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:49   0+01:13:30 R  0   0.0
   7.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:57   0+01:04:59 R  0   0.0
   8.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:57   0+01:04:59 R  0   0.0
   9.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:08   0+00:53:12 R  0   0.0
  10.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:08   0+00:52:56 R  0   0.0
  11.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:21   0+00:41:00 R  0   0.0
  12.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:21   0+00:41:00 R  0   0.0
  13.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:25   0+00:36:45 R  0   0.0
  14.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:25   0+00:36:45 R  0   0.0
  15.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:06   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0
  16.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:06   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0


  16 jobs; 2 idle, 14 running, 0 held
  [rsyoung@fermicloud125 vm-submit]$


  - I submitted some more, then they begun to turn their states to "held".


  rsyoung@fermicloud125 vm-submit]$ condor_q


   ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE
   1.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:26   0+01:40:56 H  0   0.0
   2.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:32   0+01:35:30 H  0   0.0
   3.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:40   0+01:30:33 H  0   0.0
   4.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:40   0+01:30:28 H  0   0.0
   5.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:49   0+01:20:34 H  0   0.0
   6.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:49   0+01:20:34 H  0   0.0
   7.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:57   0+01:10:36 H  0   0.0
   8.0   rsyoung         8/4  14:57   0+01:10:36 H  0   0.0
   9.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:08   0+01:00:24 H  0   0.0
  10.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:08   0+01:00:25 H  0   0.0
  11.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:21   0+00:45:26 H  0   0.0
  12.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:21   0+00:45:26 H  0   0.0
  13.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:25   0+00:45:22 H  0   0.0
  14.0   rsyoung         8/4  15:25   0+00:45:22 H  0   0.0
  15.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:06   0+00:00:00 H  0   0.0
  16.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:06   0+00:00:00 H  0   0.0
  17.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15   0+00:00:00 H  0   0.0
  18.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15   0+00:00:00 H  0   0.0


  18 jobs; 0 idle, 0 running, 18 held
  [rsyoung@fermicloud125 vm-submit]$


  - The reason is same except one.


  [rsyoung@fermicloud125 vm-submit]$ condor_q -held


  -- Submitter: fermicloud125.fnal.gov : <131.225.155.72:45210> :
  fermicloud125.fnal.gov
   ID      OWNER           HELD_SINCE HOLD_REASON
   1.0   rsyoung   8/4  16:12 Unable to read from accesskey file
   2.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:12 Unable to read from accesskey file
   3.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15 Unable to read from accesskey file
   4.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15 Unable to read from accesskey file
   5.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:14 Unable to read from accesskey file
   6.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:14 Unable to read from accesskey file
   7.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:13 Unable to read from accesskey file
   8.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:13 Unable to read from accesskey file
   9.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15 Unable to read from accesskey file
  10.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15 Unable to read from accesskey file
  11.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:12 Unable to read from accesskey file
  12.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:12 Unable to read from accesskey file
  13.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:16 Unable to read from accesskey file
  14.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:16 Unable to read from accesskey file
  15.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:11 curl_easy_perform() failed (6):
  16.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:11 Unable to read from accesskey file
  17.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15 Unable to read from accesskey file
  18.0   rsyoung         8/4  16:15 Unable to read from accesskey file


  18 jobs; 0 idle, 0 running, 18 held
  [rsyoung@fermicloud125 vm-submit]$


  Please let me know if you need further more information.

There were a few additional mails back and forth, which can be summarized as "logging in the EC2 GAHP was broken". That should /not/ be true for the build from the head of V7_7-ec2_x509-branch that I just sent Fermi, cc'ing JaimeF.

Milestones

  • Jaime will investigate to see how serious a problem this is. [DONE]
  • Fix problem. [DONE]
  • Give updated binaries to Fermi for testing
remarks:
2011-Sep-12 11:32:56 by jfrey:
There's a file descriptor leak in readShortFile() and writeShortFile(). These functions never close the fd they open.
check_ins: 2011-Sep-12 12:01   Check-in [27159]: Fix file descriptor leak in ec2_gahp. #2447 ===VersionHistory:Complete=== (By Jaime Frey )
creator: tlmiller
